sentences.sContent: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.sCn: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.sContent: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.sCn: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.sContent: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
The church was carefully restored after the war.
sentences.sCn: 战后教堂得到了精心修复。

words.tran: 滋补的，有助于复元的；恢复健康的
恢复；复位；王政复辟；归还
修补者；[计] 复位器；[计] 恢复设备；修建者

remMethod.val: re ＋ store(储存) → 身体重新储存能量 → 恢复； 修复

trans.tranOther: to make something return to its former state or condition
